When my much beloved yoga teacher retired a few years ago I went into mourning and my practice languished; I had a difficult time finding a class that worked for my aging body.  Now there's Adriene!  Her practices have everything I need/want--careful design, humor, variety, attention to form, a marriage of the inner and outer bodies--a deep sense of the joyful and every-changing yoga I once knew and loved.  I am astonished that my almost-70-year-old body is quickly able to find a home in poses that once were difficult for me.  At first, I would take a day or two's rest after a few taxing days to allow my muscles to regroup, but now I see that Adriene's practices are designed to let that happen naturally, and I am putting myself on the mat each day.  The mat has become home again--thanks, Adriene!

The spirit has everything it needs; and sometimes, the ego gets in the way with the narrative of what we are NOT or what we lack. If we just gently chip away at those patterns, we can then reveal whatever masterpiece has been there, all along. "Return" isn't so much about going back to being an older version of ourselves, but guiding us back to a place where we're aligned with our higher selves.
